page.title: 10MILTON IN THE 1900'S
page.content: CONTRIBUTIONS BY MILTON PRIMARY SCH. ID NO.00500030.GRID REF.NO.05440261. AT THE BEGINNING OF 1900's THERE WAS A LARGE POND OUTSIDE ONE OF MILTON'S PUBS,AND ALSO A PARISH POUND IN THE VILLAGE.THE OLD WAR MEMORIAL USED TO STAND NEAR WHAT'S NOW WILLOW CRESENT. BEHIND IT,AN OLD BLACKSMITH'S FORGE WAS SITUATED;THE MEMORIAL NOW STANDS ON THE CORNER OF COLES ROAD.A PERSON NAMED CONDOR OWNED THE SHOP WHICH SOLD NEARLY EVERYTHING.MR.BULL AND MR.FLACK WERE BUTCHERS AND MR.DAY WAS THE BAKER.THE BUTCHERS AND THE BAKER CAME AROUND THE VILLAGE IN VANS.MR SIMEON EASY OWNED COWS AND WAS THE LOCAL MILKMAN.LATER ON,MR.SHIPP FROM WATERBEACH,BECAME THE MILKMAN.IN 1939 MILTON WAS A VERY SMALL VILLAGE,WITH ROUGHLY ONE HUNDRED HOUSES,ALONG THE MAIN ELY TO CAMBRIDGE ROAD,AND TWO SIDE ROADS.
